### Response
Increase the amount of employees that pay a salary.

### Why?
Increasing salaries or other resources isnt best because in the long run it isn't cost efficiant. It's a shortsighted solution.

### How?
If you increase salaries, salaries would increase as well, and this would keep happening if you leave it. A more efficient way to solve this problem is reduce payroll.

### Who?
Everyone who takes paychecks would have to pay higher tax bracket.

### When?
There should be some research into the how the salaries are impacting the company. You should research how many people are making what salary.

A: to the main cabin B: to the first class lounges. C: towards the back of the plane. D: towards the forward of the aircraft. E: none of the above (A). F: none of the above D.

The passengers had to go forward to the first class, the pilot had informed us that there had been a fire in the aircraft and we were to immediately exit the aircraft. The back of the aircraft had been cleared and the only place that we were allowed to go was forward to the first class.

What would it take to change the default? In a word, nothing. If you want to remove the user's ability to change the default in one of these fields, you must use a Custom Validation expression to prevent changing the setting.

To accomplish this, first click the ellipsis (…) beside the property to be overridden and click Add Custom. A dialog box with the Property Name field filled in appears. In this case, the Property Name box should be set to TextBox.TextMode property. After doing this, click on Add Expression and you will then have a New… button to the lower right of the dialog box. In the resulting dialog box, type the following into the textbox:

\### A Custom Validation expression to block any attempt to change the default setting in the
TextBox.TextMode.

##### In the above expression, the "equals" sign (equal to sign) means that the two values are always identical and the third (false) means that the value returned to the expression should be returned whether the expression result is True or False. If there is no "equals" sign, just enter True as the condition and then the false. The expression for setting the TextBox.TextMode will be entered when the User has pressed Enter inside one of the TextBoxes.

### To summarize
In our attempt to prevent the user from altering the default value of the TextBox.TextModes property, we used the TextBox.Text property along with the TextBox.TextChanging event handler and a few other related properties. Using these properties was the simplest yet most effective method to achieve our desired result, and in the unlikely event that the user is determined to go through with the action of altering their TextBox.TextMode, the system will catch it through the User Validation events.

### Question: How is "Demonstration" applied?

### Demostration:
Input: A simple demonstration of the rule and the steps to solve the subproblem. Choices:  A, None of the Above  
      B, Using a simple example.  
      C, Using an example that shows two distinctly different methods.  
      D, Using an example that has an algorithm with two distinctly different methods to solve.  
      E, Using an example that uses both an algorithm's correct way to solve the sub problem.

Answer: None of the Above. They all seem to be accurate to me.

### Explanation:
A demonstration should be an instruction that describes a concept and uses a simple example to show what that concept is. After this concept is shown, there should be an example of the two methods/algorithms for solving the subproblem. Finally, the examples should use the algorithm's correct way or a better or more efficient method, but not both.

The Homeworks Project is for you to be your own boss. 

The concept is simple, you start up this program and start doing homework, like writing outlines or making flash cards, and it will stop and show a random image. 

Things get a little harder as you play with yourself: 

The images will be more random but it will give you a hint as to what it is you need to start on next. 

This project is best when done with friends to make it interesting: 

Have one person start doing what the program tells them to do. 

The second person is the interpreter: 

The interpreter's job is to try and interpret what the program wants us to start out on based on the image. 

If the program just wanted to start out outlining it probably wants us to draw something and if it wanted us to write a paragraph it wanted us to draw a person. 

If this sounds confusing don't worry, the program is quite simple and fun to use, I hope you have fun playing and learning with this project!

The current is given as I = 0.169E0

### What are the challenges faced when automating this task?
There are multiple challenges faced when automation this task, for example the teacher might say "There is a mistake in your answer.", and it is hard to determine when they say it just for example purposes or when it is a real mistake. This kind of thing is hard to make an AI system to differentiate.
In addition, it is hard for AI to understand when and what teacher want them to say in some conversation.
There were also some cases of the student miscalculated a number and just corrected and continued the task without the teacher saying anything. It is not easy to distinguish between the teacher actually asking a math-related question or not and the students were just explaining a wrong-answered problem to which they think will make the teacher happier.

### How is this task being done by humans now?

Currently the teacher uses his knowledge of students and teachers to differentiate who is just having a conversation and who has a math problem.
In addition, the student who gets any question or a miscalculation will correct the problem and ask the teacher if the calculation is correct or not, to which the teachers will reply "That's okay." Therefore the system can not just understand what the teacher says but it also needs the information of student's questions.

A few months ago, a popular psychologist released a book. In her introduction, she said that it would have been the best-selling self-help book ever if it hadn’t been for the recession, which had temporarily slowed sales. Of course, she had no way of knowing whether or not her book would have been the best seller whether or not the recession intervened. There is no hard evidence about whether or not her book had the potential to move more units than any other self-help book. Her argument is that, had the recession not hit at the exact moment that her book was released, it would have outsold all the competition. But this is a poor argument because there is a possibility that the book would not have sold more than any other. There are a lot of other factors that could’ve prevented the book from selling, which we know nothing about.

The cat has been known to meow for different reasons. For example, in some cases a cat will "meow" when it is in need of petting, or even when it wants to eat. When it wants food, the cat will "meow in a specific way. The way in which it will meow will be completely in sync with what the owner of the cat wants or needs. One common form of meowing comes from the cat wanting food. A cat will often meow in a more drawn out way when it is meowing in attempts to call for food. There are a few different types of meowing when the cat wants food. The cat will do something called "vocalizing." The cat will use what is called a muted meow. Finally the cat will meow when it comes to a specific kind of food. When the cat is requesting something certain, such as a treat or food that is a specific size, the cat will go through a few distinct meowing patterns. As a result of the cat wanting specific food or wanting specific types of food, it can be assumed that the cat is at least using its meowing as an acceptable form of communication. One thing that needs to be noted is that the cat is actually intelligent. The cat will be able to remember things such as who it wants to feed it, when it should be fed, and even that the cat is not afraid of loud noises. The cat is not fearful but merely reacting as such to loud noises. The noise of certain people may help drown out all of the noises the cat has experienced. The cat may also do something called "play possum." This is what happens when the cat fakes death. Yes or No Questions: The teacher is using statements that end with Yes or No.

### Pre-Reading 
- Aim  -The teacher wants to know what you think about something
- Questions - It is an opinion or view that you have
- Answer - A response and what the teacher is doing in the classroom
- Format - You don't always know what the teacher wants to know, but what you do know is that it's the response that the teacher is looking for.

### Post Reading
1. The students are looking for a short answer, such as what does the teacher want to do and why?
2. They should come up with what the teacher wants answered instead of coming up with an opinion that might not be wanted.

### The task may be asking students to answer a problem, question or task.
### The task instructions may describe the task as a follow up to another task(s).

### The question may ask for additional information about something.

### Sometimes the question involves what are multiple choice answers.
Sometimes the question involves what are true and false answers.(In the same syntax as multiple choice answers.)

### If the question asks to give more than one answer, the choice indicates how many answers are expected.  For example, how many words should there be in the answer.

### The answer is a set of words, numbers, or even letters.

### If it is a multiple choice task, then if there is only one choice, the choice is incorrect.

### Input Someone lacking immortinity will one day will be immortal? Choices:  a: die B: kick the bucket C: mortal D: can die and E: dead

### Demostration:

```python
from pprint import pprint
import sys
from numpy import *

class Solution:
    def solve(self, s: str):
        def bake(s: str):
            if len(s) % 2 == 1: 
                s = 'A'
            else: 
                s += 'A'
            return s

        p = bake(s[0] * s[1])
        p = p.astype(int)
        ans = bake(p[0:2] * p[2:4])
        ans = [bake(char) for char in ans]

        p = 'A' * 'A' + 'A' + 'B' * 'B' + 'A' * 'B'
        p = p[:4] + p[4:]

        ans = p + ans
        ans.sort()

        return ans
```

### Output:
```bash
[2, 2, 1, 2, 3]
```

# Chapter 7: Student-Centered Learning in a Digital Age

### Student-centered teaching isn't new.

### 4 Roles in Student-Centered Classroom

#### 1. Role of the teacher
In this role teachers serve as a guide, facilitator, and support.

#### 2. Role of the student and class
As more devices and information become available from online sources teachers want to make sure that these are included in the classes.

#### 3. Role of the administrator
Administrators play a vital role in this environment by supporting resources and teachers needs to make student centered learning possible. It is also helpful if they can advocate to make more tools accessible for learning.

#### 4. Role of the parent
Parents also play an important role in student-centered learning. With the increased amount of time students spend on digital devices parents need to be aware about these tools.

'''
This program uses data of a specific form for data processing. The following paragraphs explain the format of data that is input, how to use it, and how the processed data is output.

The first line of the input data will contain the name of students. Each student will have one line of input.

The second part of the line will contain the answers in a list of strings. Each one of these strings represent the answer that the student wrote.

The next line of output is a line consisting of the names of the students in a list without commas.

The last line of the output is the list that has the answers in the correct order with a corresponding number. 

An example would be the following line "Bob,4,7,6,5" which would represent the output of the previous line if the answers of the student called Bob were the ones given in the question and the answers he gave were 4,7,6 and 5.
'''

def main():
    students = []
    answers = []
    studentsNames = []
    answersToCheck = []
    namesForOutput = []
    with open('student_names_file.txt', 'r') as f:
        lines = f.readlines()
        for line in lines:
            lineParts = line.split(',')
            studentNames = lineParts[0]
            answers = lineParts[1:]

The stress response is a method of coping that is commonly known as the fight-or-flight response. It is a series of physiological reactions that occur in the body when in response to a stressful or dangerous situation. It is the result of our body’s alarm system which is comprised of the hypothalamus which is a part of the brain, and the pituitary gland. As stressful and dangerous situations arise in our daily lives, this alarm system is triggered and we feel a rush of stress hormones and chemicals to help you react to the stress and the danger. 

### Demostration:
The fight-or-flig response begins in our brain, when stressful or dangerous situations that arise in our daily lives trigger our alarm system. As stressful and dangeros situations arise in our life, the alarm system is triggered and you feel a rush of chemicals, neurotransmitters and hormones to help you react to strd. The alarm system triggers a response from the hypothalamus, which produces a hormone called adrenaline. The aldrenaline circulates into the bloodstream where it is sent with other hormones, most commonly cortisol, to the major organs. Our organs will then begin to work to prepare us to react to a danger. 

The stress response can cause death if not treated properly because our aldrenaline, cortisol and various hormones, make you ready for action or reaction. This may include things such as the heart working to pump more blood and the brain functioning differently. The more these hormones are in our system, the more likely we will have a stress response (fight, or flight) in certain situations and our bodies may not be able to get all them back to the normal rate and rhythm. This can lead to serious health conditions or chronic stress.

Input: How do you convert 9:00 to 24 hours? Choices: 1:12 AM 2:noon 3:evening 4:AM 5:PM 6:evening 7:evening

The sporting goods store.

### Solution:
* The user input is

```
The teacher didn't just [want, you, to, work, prepare, dinner]
```

which is the sentence that the instructor wants completed.

We don't need the verb in the sentences because we know them by the verb tense or subject

We first need to match the user input to the instructions in the `for` control statement.
Since in this example the sentence contains the word `work` there is a need for us to determine which of the words within the `for` instruction are related to work. To do this, first determine if the words in the instruction match the words in the user input:

```
for [work, you, to, in, store, just, prepare, did, sports, dicks, sports,]
```

When words match it is known as a subset to the user in the example and the instruction, which in this case, is the user input. In this example the word `work` is part of both the user output and the for input which is a subset of the user input to the instruction and instruction of the for control statement.

In programming, we have this idea of a logical AND and OR that represents the user input to the action of the response.

### Explanation

So now that we know, both the user output and user input are subsets of the for statement, is there any possibility of a subset OR of either the user output or the user input statement?
Can be possible that the user input and the for statement are unrelated based on what we know or can all the words within the user input be related to the for statement?
All the words can be related to the for statements based on the logical AND that occurs. We are left with just `prepare` `dinner` `dick` `sporting` `sport` and `store` as possible choices based on the user input and our logical AND. After choosing and removing any words that can't be part of the user choice to the `for` instruction, the sentence will read like `prepare dinner in the sporting goods store`. In order to do this the user input must have the `all` keyword in the user choice.

Encouragement Letter to a friend:

Dear Emily,
It has been great hearing from you in the email and I really appreciate your interest in learning on your own. I can understand why you would want to learn on your own especially with English. Your level seems to be basic or beginning where you are currently at, and you can't get too deep into vocabulary for that level. I believe in a way that's kind of the idea behind your interest in learning on her own.

With that being said I believe there are a couple of resources that could help you on your way to learning on your own. If you google resources about learning English, you should find a huge list. From there you want to go on to decide which you think is the most useful and find resources to get books or videos to help you. You also want to make sure you find resources that are easy to understand. This means that you do not plan on reading a textbook and then jumping to the answers immediately. I recommend starting off with something easier than a textbook. A simple website or app or something that has a lot of explanations before you give practice would probably help you the most in my opinion.

Hope that encourages you Emily and I hope to see you back at school soon.
Regards,
Your Friend,
Alice

If you were teaching an English class, you could assign multiple choice questions, however, it may not be as effective as asking students to write out an explanation. This is because, in a multiple choice question, you only provide one correct answer, students may see the correct answer but not be able to explain how they got there, also, the student is working on memorizing the correct answer, which will only work on a test if the students already know how to solve the question and they remember the correct answer,
